website_summaries.verdict: An affordable way to make your own nut milk. Ideal for 1 to 2 people.
pros: The bag is an ideal size for small, personal-use batches of milk
Bag is well constructed with quality seams
The fine mesh fabric produces smooth, creamy nut and seed milks
Comes in at a wallet-friendly price point
cons: Bag opening is narrow, making pouring liquid into the bag a little tedious

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleaning
customer_reviews.text: While this appears to be a simple bag, it somehow manages to shed all food remnants very easy during the cleaning process. Half the reason I had never tried making almond milk was because I would have had to deal with cleaning up. This bag is a breeze to clean. To clean just turn inside out and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Neve

customer_reviews.title: Works well for oat milk
customer_reviews.text: I went through a phase of making my own almond milk. Eventually two things happened...1. I got sick of the hassle. And 2. I put my nut milk bag through the wash (don't do this) and ruined it. Recently I wanted to try making oat milk because it seemed a lot easier. However, many people will tell you not to use a nut milk bag because it won't strain the milk well enough. Well, again...wanting to keep everything easy I decided to use one anyhow. Bought this and so far, so good! I don't know what those people we talking about because I don't have chunks of anything in my oat milk and I'm completely happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Agent_CooperTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get what what pictured
customer_reviews.text: I did not get what was pictured or described for this product! The one I received only has one round corner, it has a cotton tie not nylon and it is made of stiff white fabric. This is an Amazon Choice item. I don't understand what happened.
customer_reviews.author: coolek

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best nut milk bags I've ever used. I've not bought nut milk since I got one of these. My recipe: 2 handfuls of almonds, (I buy mine 100% raw and organic from a farm in CA), 2 cups filtered water, blend, filter that through the bag(I massage the bag and pulp to extract as much as possible), add one spoonful molasses, one spoonful 100% raw honey, and 2 tablespoons non-gmo soy lecithin, blend again. I love it and am able to have my milk any time with just 15 min prep time. Will only use this bag, it's the best out there. We're so impressed we are trying it now to filter our veg glycerin tinctures.
customer_reviews.author: T. Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: The One I Received Was Not As Pictured
customer_reviews.text: First of all, Amazon was great about returning this for free. But you should know that the one I received was not as pictured. I bought this specifically for the shape as the curved corners are easier to clean and instead of being U shaped, it was curved on one side and had a sharp right angle on the other. Ellie's Best is much better! I bought that one through Amazon as well.
customer_reviews.author: SMQ

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Would Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I've used this 4 times for almond milk, and it works flawlessly. The only reason that I wrote 4 stars is that they designed the bag to be used inside-out (this is good, and useful) to be easier to clean, but didn't follow suit with the rim. You can arrange it to have all seams outside, but it makes the bag somewhat smaller. Would have been 5 stars if not for that oversight.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Robillard

customer_reviews.title: Fine mesh but didn't hold up very long at all
customer_reviews.text: I got this about 7 weeks ago, use it a few times a week, and today the stiches opened a long a seam letting pulp through. My last version of this bag lasted a few years, so I guess the quality has changed since then. It does however have a finer mesh than the Ellies Best bag and the shape is good for milking.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Overall a pretty good bag for making your own almond milk
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty good bag for making your own almond milk. However it was a bit annoying to find brown almond pieces stuck in the stitch - the stitch along the bottom of this bag is like a bag in itself. Small particles get stuck in it and it's quite hard to wash them out. It's so hard to remove those particles that I just eventually leave them there and dry the bag. Nothing too bad, but not sure if it's sanitary enough to use it this way.
customer_reviews.author: greenocean

customer_reviews.title: Great quality so far
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy that the corners are rounded and that it is very easy to clean compared to cheesecloth. I have used it to make oat milk so far and have been pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to make nut milks and absolutely love it! The mesh is very fine, so my milks come out silky with no grit at all. I handwash mine, but it's very easy to clean. It's very durable to being squeezed and wrung to get every last drop out! I used it once to strain watermelon juice which of course stained the nylon, but a quick dip in a bleach solution cleaned that out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Leeluu

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy. Ratio of almonds to water 1
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. No reason to ever buy almond milk again! Easy peasy. Ratio of almonds to water 1:4. So, you can use 1 cup almonds (soaked overnight, soaking water discarded) and 4 cups water - blend. Strain through the nut milk bag. Keeps for about 2 days. I added some vanilla to mine. Yum! Soooooo much better than store bought (get used to it not being sweet though).
customer_reviews.author: Bay Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Cold-brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described, along with the item I received a photocopy of a hand-written note from the seller describing who they were and their raw lifestyle. I bought this as a gift to my brother so he can make cold-brew coffee in a couple mason jars like a true hipster. Additionally I received a couple nutritional supplements in the package... that were expired! Thanks I guess.
customer_reviews.author: JigglyTofu

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Almond milk has never tasted so good. It's amazing the difference between the store bought brand and home made. INGREDIENTS 1 cup raw unsalted almonds, skin-on 4 cups filtered water, plus more water for soaking almonds 1 1/2 tsp honey or agave nectar, or one whole pitted date (optional) Dash of salt (optional) YOU WILL ALSO NEED Blender or food processor, nut milk bag 1 quart glass jar or storage container Prep Time: 12 - 48 Hours Total Time: 12:05 - 8 Hours 5 Minutes Servings: About 1 quart almond milk
customer_reviews.author: L5

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've used to make soy and nutmilk. All of these are a bit time consuming to clean. This one works well and seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: VideoJoy

customer_reviews.title: Depends on What You Need
customer_reviews.text: This bag is so tightly woven that the juice doesn't easily come through and so it's a little time consuming if you're a perfectionist and want ALL the juice to come through. The other issue for me is that certain juices I make (purple cabbage being one) produce a bit of foam - If you're as intent as I am about getting all the juice squeezed through the bag, you're also squeezing the foam through. My only other problem is that this bag is fairly narrow and just barely fits around the top of the container for my juicer which limits how many containers it can be used with.
customer_reviews.author: Seeking Serenity

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I use this for squeezing the remaining juice from pulp, and I'm hoping that the threads are durable enough to hold together. Unfortunately the bag that is being sold by Home Brew Ohio did not come with any recommended care instructions and isn't the same shape as the one in the displayed product photo. On a positive note, the seller is a prompt shipper, the item that I received was brand new without defects, and my package arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Being new to juicing, I was a little skeptical of the need for one of these. I didn't mind a bit of pulp in my fresh juice. But I found that I was making enough juice for several days, and that the pulp wasn't so appealing in the older juice. So sifting it through this bag really improved the juice. I'm giving it 5 stars not just because it does the intended job, but because it is really sturdily constructed. I put a lot of pressure on it when I'm squeezing the juice through it, and it holds up. (It'd be a mess if it didn't!). Good product. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Cymry

customer_reviews.title: They worked but the mesh let's fiber thru because it ...
customer_reviews.text: They worked but the mesh let's fiber thru because it isn't tight enough. Also, the stitching cannot withstand the pressure from squeezing so it breaks through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for oat milk!
customer_reviews.text: This bag works great for making oat milk! However, it is a bit of an inflexible material that can make it hard to milk out the last bits. Additionally, it is not as well made as it looks in the listing picture and some of the seams were loose but once I tied them up it worked well and has stayed together.
customer_reviews.author: Lily King

customer_reviews.title: What goes in the bag stays in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: This was the Perfect next step for my homebrew kombucha gig. Tea fines get through mesh, but loose leaf tea is going to stay put. I love not having to strain to strain! Get it?? I did and I have not looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Grossnickle

customer_reviews.title: I can make any type of nut milk.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god I can make my nut milks, strain it and not worry about getting the meal into the milk. The milk is creamy and delicious. I am so glad that I purchased this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen M.

customer_reviews.title: not really big enough for the task
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this bag for almond milk. It's just to small. I wanted one that would fit on the top of my 8 cup measuring cup and this one does not, not even close, so it's awkward, as you really have to hold it in one hand while pouring it with the other, not really very helpful. I've since found another use for it as a sprout bad, just put the soaked seeds in, rinse, and sprout. Works great for that. It seems to be made well and the fabric is strong and cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I've done nut milks with cheesecloth...YUCK. This bag makes it soooo easy. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Aloha

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold brew.
customer_reviews.text: I use my brew bag to make large batches of cold brew coffee. It can hold a pound of coffee grounds, which makes about 2 weeks of coffee concentrate. The bag is easy to clean, and I've reused it many times.
customer_reviews.author: Dubya

customer_reviews.title: Cold press coffee anyone?
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag for making almond milk AND cold press coffee. I can't believe I ever made cold press stuffing the grounds through a strainer and waiting and waiting for it to drip and drain. Ain't nobody got time to wait for good coffee to drain! :) It's the perfect size too.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Good strainer sack
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to make oat milk, and it has been great to use! As with any bag, the cleanup takes a bit of time, but it's worth it, as it makes a great oat milk strainer!
customer_reviews.author: Linux-guy

customer_reviews.title: changed my Almond Milk life!!
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy cheesecloth ever again! (unless I need it for something other than making nut milk). What a mess! This product makes things so easy--no more mess, no more buying cheesecloth over & over (waste of money!). Durable and well made, can withstand lots of squishing & squeezing and then washing afterward. THANK YOU. I cannot believe I waited so long to buy this. Also, very inexpensive for the amount of benefit that I receive. An essential for any homemade nut milk kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Max D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it to make carrot juice, almond milk, and oat milk and works perfectly. Juicing does stain a little but nothing some soap and water can't handle :)
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Portillo

customer_reviews.title: We use this on the spouts going into our Rain Barrels.
customer_reviews.text: We have several rain barrels and we put this bag on the end of the pour spout so all the bits & pieces don't end up in the rain barrel. Easy to rinse out and catches all the crap.
customer_reviews.author: D & R fm VA

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Used this yesterday to make almond milk for the first time. I was surprised at how well it worked. I'm looking forward to using it over and over again for my new nut milk recipes. It was super easy to clean too. I just ran running water over it till it was clear and layed it on the counter top to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Heels Above

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to get these?
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't make almond milk (or any nut milk) without these bags. Think about it. You can either soak the nuts and peel each one by hand, or soak, blend and pour the liquid through the bag where the nut meat and skins get left behind. I'll give you a few minutes to decide! You can also use what's left in the bag in your dehydrator to make crackers or other goodies!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: ... smaller width wise at the mouth than I would like but it strains fine and seems to be made ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is smaller width wise at the mouth than I would like but it strains fine and seems to be made of a durable fabric. I can't tell what the drawstring is for because it does not cinch the bag. I wish it would. I've been using it multiple times weekly. It cleans up easily. I have to put it into a half gallon milk carton with the top cut off to strain almond milk. It's not wide enough for a bowl. Overall a decent product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Novak

customer_reviews.title: Good for straining yoghurt
customer_reviews.text: Usually strain yoghurt with cheesecloth but this made it so easier and it washed well
customer_reviews.author: S.Lesley Baird

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I use it to make hemp milk and sometimes tea, it’s great for both! Highly recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Joy Nettles

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I was doing a juice detox for 5 days with a blender. I was using a strainer to get the juice out, but after discovering the nut milk bag, there's no comparison. I got 2-3x more juice from my blended veggies/fruit by using this bag. Get this if you want a cheaper alternative to buying a juicer and you just have a blender.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: This was my second order. The first was a trial to see if I liked it. As I said in my previous review, it did a great job sprouting some rye for rejuvelac, then it came clean in the next laundry load. It doesn't care what color the load is since it does not take any color from the laundry nor, since it has no dye, does it put any color into the laundry. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: V. E. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I am going to order more of these....I have found so many uses for this...I even use one to hold a bar of soap in the shower...throw the bar in swish it around with a bit of water and you can bathe with it rinse it off and hang it up....very useful product....would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laurita

customer_reviews.title: Best for homemade almond milk!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of nut milk bags and these are amazing for the job!! They are sturdy, large and the holes are way small. You can really squeeze these and get all the milk out with out compromising the integrity of the bag. Holds up well! Best ones so far!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy nut bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy nut bag. I've used it at least twice a week every week making almond milk for the past few months. So far i have had no problems with the material getting thin and coming into a hole. It has a very tight weave which i love because i don't want to strain my milk twice to remove pulp. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: christine kidd

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Got this one and have been making my own milks since then. Got several more to give to friends. Have made oatmeal, almond and hempseed milk - all turned out great. Super easy to clean. Much better than cheese cloth.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Secure!
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for straining the contents of my first herbal tincture. Great bag with an even better price point. Did exactly what I wanted it to - and the drawstring at the top was great for securely wrapping it around the lip of the mason jar I was using. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Ashe

customer_reviews.title: Brew mesh bag
customer_reviews.text: Made very flimzy and some of the stitching was falling apart before it was even used. Does make the whole almond milk process go so much smoother. Ordered and paid for 3 and only received 1.
customer_reviews.author: Brigit Haucke

customer_reviews.title: I bought another nut milk bag at a health food store and did not like it. So
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag for the last 4 years to make nut milks at home. Because of frequent repetitive use, it is understandably worn out. To replace it, I bought another nut milk bag at a health food store and did not like it. So, I threw it away and placed another order to buy this one on Amazon, so that I can use it for the next 4 years. It keeps the nut particles inside the bag and lets all the fluid out. It is easy to clean and it dries fast. Love it. The best bag.
customer_reviews.author: SunMoonSky

customer_reviews.title: Multi use of nut bag.
customer_reviews.text: I use the nut bags when creating my product and when juicing.
customer_reviews.author: Aunties'Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I wrapped the string around the top so I could squeeze the bag a little tighter without squeezing any pulp out of the top. I've only used it to make almond milk so far.
customer_reviews.author: randomdude1978

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, and perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: I've been making nut milks for a while, and making do with a produce bag. But the mesh of the produce bag isn't quite as tight as the mesh of this bag. It was available and convenient, and did an OK job, but this bag lets much less deposit through and is easier to clean. It's definitely the proper tool for this job, and makes the process a tiny bit quicker and simpler for me.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cold Brew Coffee, but stains
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make cold brew coffee, and it is perfect for straining out all of the coffee grinds, but it does stain, just FYI. Other than that though, this is a great mesh bag, and not a huge deal really that it stains (I expected this with coffee.)
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom to make almond milk from scratch and she loved it, could not find it at any other store. You have to keep the mom happy
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: First nutmilk bag a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I love homemade almondmilk, but after a cheesecloth exploded pulp and milk all over my kitchen, I knew I had to make some changes before I continued. There are so many different nut milk bags on Amazon so I rolled the dice and bought this one. It works like a charm! The milk was easily strained and very smooth. I agree with another's assessment that the seam at the bottom wasn't well thought out, but for the most part, it's easy enough to clean. Whatever little bits of pulp are left in the seam dry and are easily brushed off.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon R.

customer_reviews.title: Great strainer bag
customer_reviews.text: I've used this about 6 times now and it's a great strainer bag. I use it for home made almond milk and I don't see any problems developing. It seems very well made and should last us a long while. I will probably purchase another to use next time I make jams and jellies. Much easier to deal with than cheese cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mendick

customer_reviews.title: Make your blender into a juicer
customer_reviews.text: If you love juice, buy this now. Put any sort of juice source into your blender, put the mush into the bag, and squeeze the juice out. Voila! I have made apple juice, watermelon juice, pear juice, strawberry juice, carrot juice with this. Its pretty cool and can really upgrade the blenders abilities for just a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Silverback

customer_reviews.title: 1 bad bag
customer_reviews.text: Two different bags. One felt poor and does not actually drain properly. I have had a couple batches of sprouts spoiled due to this
customer_reviews.author: Greg Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for nut milk and cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: We use these bags for making nut milk and cold brew coffee. They work very well for both applications. THIS IS A GREAT PRODUCT. The fine mesh keeps the small pulp and coffee grounds out of your drink. I recommend this product for anyone wanting to make their own nut milk or cold brew coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for homemade Almond Milk!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm really liking this nut bag. I mainly use it for when I make Almond Milk using my Vitamix. It does a great job straining the fibrous material after the Vitamix chops up those almonds and it's easy to use and easy to clean. I've used it probably 5-6 times so far and it's holding up well. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: So easy to make nut milk now!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is such a great invention. Before, I had to use half a pkg of cheesecloth to strain my rice and nut milks. It was a MESS and large pieces often got through as I struggled to strain it. But with this bag -- EASY! Just pour it in! Your straining is done in a minute. And turn the bag inside out to clean it -- it's beyond simple.
customer_reviews.author: Likesgoodthings

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Kava tea
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It's bigger than I expected, but that is not a bad thing at all. I use it for Kava tea powder. Some of the powder did manage to get through. But not much. All in all, for the price, I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: CindyTR

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Use it to strain celery juice from pulp. Works fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these 2 nut bags every other day now for about a month and, so far, they're holding up great! I've used them to strain soy milk, almond milk, fresh squeezed juice to remove the pulp, etc. They're the perfect size. The only thing negative I can say is that the pull strings have started to come apart a bit. I just tied knots on the ends and they're fine. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nsales

customer_reviews.title: Liked the shape of the old one a bit better
customer_reviews.text: I make almond and coconut milk a couple times a week and got this second nut bag as a back up. I didn't even think I ordered the same one as the shape and material on this seems so different. It works fine, but I liked that my first one had a corner tip on it to help keep the bag straining at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Dont purchase poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this two months ago and was excited to you use-until it tore apart. This bag is made by sewing two pieces of cheese clothes together. The seams of the bag has torn in several places, rendering the bag useless as the nut milk leaks though large holes. I am going to purchase a regular cheese cloths and not try to get too fancy. Do yourself a favor and do the same.
customer_reviews.author: RealShopper06

customer_reviews.title: Nut Milk Bag
customer_reviews.text: This nut milk bag is a bit bigger than the Zimtal Nut Milk Bag. The fabric is a bit stiffer and not as white as the Zimtal Bag. The holes in the Zimtal bag is finer though both bags work well to filter my soymilk perfectly. It is easy to wash and dries quickly. For the price and size of the bag, it is more affordable ($6.95); the Zimtal bag was ($9.95).
customer_reviews.author: GoldMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Nut Milk Bag because a friend recommended I try making my own Almond milk and I could save money making my own. I found that the bag appears to be good quality, but it didn't come with instructions, so I had to look it up on line. I was told I can make "cheese" with the pulp, but am still haven't. I'm not sure if this will be as cost effective as I had hoped, and might wind out costing more to make my own. Still working on it, but I can say that my Almond milk was DELICIOUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird413

customer_reviews.title: Great Nut Milk bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Nut mIlk bag, very high quality and works perfectly for my needs - making almond milk for my family. In the package was a very nice note from Matt Monarch the owner of the company and also a couple of free samples, chia seeds and a natural vitality drink mix, which was a nice surprise. If you are looking for a nut milk bag then look no further!
customer_reviews.author: eastlala

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and helped filter the fruit from our mead.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli McKenzie-Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but develop holes after a while
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these bags and using them to make nut milk and also for sprouting. They do work pretty well, but eventually they develop a small hole or tear so that when you squeeze out the milk some of the pulp comes out as well. They are quite easy to clean. A better bag is the Vitamix nut bag. More expensive, but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been frustrated trying to strain my nut milk using sieves and cheese cloth before I bought the bag. This nut milk bag is amazing! It's so easy and quick. The only thing that kept me from giving 5 stars is that the way it's sewn gives the bag a rather large seam on the outside that makes it feel like it's inside out. Not a big deal and doesn't interfere with the use of the bag....just an asthetic irritation.
customer_reviews.author: UnknownBeauty

customer_reviews.title: Porous and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I needed the 'Nut Milk Bag' for straining juice when using a Vitamix. It's a great size, durable and easy to clean. Works much better than plain old cheese cloth. It's easier to manipulate and it lasted over a month which surprised me. I've heard people use it for making cheese and have had good results. I might try that next. I definitely recommend this item for straining.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: I have tried other nut milk bags and like this one the best
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other nut milk bags and like this one the best. I first purchased this one four years ago and use it a lot. I just ordered another one to use as a back up. Am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S

customer_reviews.title: Used this bag to make grape jelly. Even with ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this bag to make grape jelly. Even with straining it twice the results were still cloudy. It was my first attempt at jelly, so perhaps my technique is lacking the right skills?
customer_reviews.author: Bratpane

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, a bit a pain to clean sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, a bit a pain to clean sometimes, but absolutely does what it is supposed to. I would just change the stitching on the top so it is easier to clean. I'm just now realizing I could turn the bag inside out to accomplish much the same result. I will try that when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate product description and picture
customer_reviews.text: It isn’t rounded like how the picture and description leads you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Better than cheesecloth
customer_reviews.text: Better than cheesecloth. Very fine but sturdy mesh, works great to filter solids, and holds up to squeezing and wringing. Washable and reusable.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: This nut bag is very well made. The stitching is very good and the bag withstands a lot of squeezing without breaking. It is a bit small...fits over a glass, but won't fit over a medium or large bowl which is fine for my needs. The handwritten copy of a note to customers from the people at Rawfoodworld.com was really nice and appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Glorified Rice

customer_reviews.title: Works as a yogurt strainer, too
customer_reviews.text: This holds about half a batch of yogurt made in the Instant Pot with a gallon of milk. I like that it's very easy to clean out and can go in the washing machine - it's so much easier than using tea towels.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kejabana

customer_reviews.title: Milking my almods
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great - I use them to make almond milk and they work perfectly. They are sturdy, easy to use with the drawstring on the top and the right size - neither too big nor too small. Care is easy too - can wash them out after use without much effort. Recommend for almond milkers
customer_reviews.author: Jubda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have to get around to making my own almond milk
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Makes life much easier.
customer_reviews.text: Made straining my almond milk a LOT faster and easier than using cheesecloth! The mesh is extremely fine & seems to be well made. It's large & fit to the bottom of the juice pitcher I used, so I was able to pour all my liquid into it at one time & get it done quick.
customer_reviews.author: FireFly

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make coconut milk and have been very happy with it. The bag is larger than I thought by looking at the picture and strains the coconut pulp wonderfully. This is also easy to clean by hand, I just turn it inside out and rinse then let it air dry. If need another I will purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than cheesecloth! I use it for nutmilks & to press juice. It's also very easy to clean! For the juice, I keep all of the ends, stalks etc. from making smoothies and food prep in a container in the fridge, and when it gets full I blend it all in the blender and use the Nut Milk bag to get just the juice out of it. Sometimes I'll add an apple to the blender too. It makes for a fabulous morning with tons of extra energy. I'm thinking maybe I can get by without a messy and expensive juicer, using this bag :-)
customer_reviews.author: Barcelona

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and it makes smooth and creamy milk!
customer_reviews.text: I do have to say that I have a vitamix, too. So, I am able to blend my almonds/coconut really well before pouring it into the nut milk bag. It takes awhile to squeeze all the milk through (6-8 minutes), but it is worth it when it is done! The only thing is there is no instruction sheet that comes with the bag - or at least to my knowledge (maybe I unknowingly tossed it?). So, search online for a recipe for nut milks.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, micro filter, great product for making almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: Laura ogannessyan

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and will last a long time. Dry quickly. Easy to clean. Many uses.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and will last a long time. Dry quickly. Easy to clean. Many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Ciardelli

customer_reviews.title: Is a good filter but not that good if you are trying to make COLD BREW
customer_reviews.text: I worked as a barista and wanted to brew my own cold brew at home. This is a good filter for my COARSE beans but doesn't really filter that well. I am glad I tried it and works well when I don't have any filters but I would still suggest using this bag AND coffee filter to strain your cold brew perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: sarah m

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Thanks.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I use this to put Silica Gel Beads in for my fire safe. Very satisfied. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: R Cheney

customer_reviews.title: Works well for oat milk.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I wanted to make oat milk and needed this fine mesh. It works great. It's straightforward to clean. Also I got it because it's fun to say "nut bag".
customer_reviews.author: David Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've recently adopted a clean diet which includes making shakes from almond nut milk. For the first month I used a cheese cloth to strain the nuts from the liquid. I was about to give up as it was time consuming and messy for me. This Nut Milk Bag has made the process so easy, clean and efficient. Not only did it keep the nuts separated very well, I ended up with more milk than I had with the cheese cloth method. I had no idea the cheese cloth I was using absorbed the liquid as much as it did. I LOVE this product!
customer_reviews.author: J Shields

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and strength, can twist it very hard to squeeze juice. Also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia D.

customer_reviews.title: Washes easily!!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Washes easily! No wear near as messy as using a towel or cheesecloth.
customer_reviews.author: Cptjer

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: I love using this for making almond milk. It is less messy than using cheese cloth. I am very happy with my purchase. The tiny holes are just right for making milk. The quality is nice also.
customer_reviews.author: Taking It Back Home

customer_reviews.title: By far the best nut milk bad I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: By far the best nut milk bad I've ever used. I make coconut milk at least once a week and after over a year of use, it's showing no signs of wear. I'd love it if they made a larger option too. I took off one star because mine is smaller than 12" x 12".
customer_reviews.author: MegaLove

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy instructions and quality product. The coffee tasted great after using this. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jskiba

customer_reviews.title: Last Almond Milk Bag I'll ever Need
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag from Amazon in 2011, different shape and higher price ($11.95.) I don't use it all the time, but I've have been very happy with how well made it is. The seams are well finished hold up to pressure and the nylon rinses out pretty easily. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dak

customer_reviews.title: Cold Brew Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make a weeks worth of cold brew coffee for myself. It works great since cold brew needs a coarser grind. I normally clean it by soaking in warm water wth dish soap--I change the water 3 times and hang to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make almond milk on a pretty regular basis. My only complaint is that sometimes the pulp makes a mess out of the inside of the bag, but that's to be expected and not through any fault of the bag. I get smooth milk from it and it is easy to clean. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SMG713

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, Great Company!!`
customer_reviews.text: I actually had to go to the company's facebook page and like them because they treated me so well. I loved the personalized letter, all of the freebees and the fact they they sent everything so fast and well packaged, I mean they are really the type of company that you just don't see anymore, you know, the ones who care about there customers!!!!! Aside from that, The bag is great!!! I love love love cashew milk so this was perfect for me!!! Get this bag, it's better than strainers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stufflover

customer_reviews.title: Great for almond milk
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these bags, I guess from different sellers. One was very soft and the latest one was much more stiff. Both had the same outcome though. Worked very well. Im using these to only make almond milk after being blending in a vitamix
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for me - clean - washable
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with the product when making almond milk. My biggest qualms are that it isn't as large as I would like. Otherwise, it filters the milk wonderfully! I have had a lot of success washing it by hand and in the washing machine. The almond pulp is very usable afterwards as well. Thanks for the wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Tritraining

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a nut milk bag to make almond milk. This does what I need it for and the almond milk comes out smooth. The shredded almonds stay out of my milk. For the price I recommend getting one of these. Fairly easy to clean too, just rinse for a minute under water.
customer_reviews.author: nydunes

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Way to small!!! Description does not explain that 12x12 is the entire area, not the dimensions. Very disappointed! Amazon wants more to charge almost as much to return as the item cost. Not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki W

customer_reviews.title: not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Bad doesn't look anything like the one pictured. Threads are very loose and frayed on top and bottom. Bought this bag because it's "Ohio-made" and I'm from Ohio. Whoops.
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh

product_meta.title: Home Brew Ohio Nut Milk Bag for Almond Milk/Soy Milk, 9" x 12"
product_meta.description: Size:9" x 12"High-quality nut Milk and sprouting bags. Each bag is handmade and quality tested to ensure that you receive the finest product.These bags are ideal for any number of straining or sprouting uses. Fine mesh Material minimizes sediment and allows for sprouting of even the Smallest of seeds and grains, while bias cut, surge sewn construction ensures durability. Size 9" x 12".
feature_bullets: Round shape design to minimize sediment and allows for sprouting of even the smallest of seeds and grains
